alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Chaves County Plains; De Baca County; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 6:14PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...SCATTERED DRY SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WITH GUSTY WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN, SAN MIGUEL, WESTERN DE BACA, NORTHWESTERN CHAVES, SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL, SANTA FE, SOUTHEASTERN MORA, EAST CENTRAL SOCORRO, GUADALUPE, BERNALILLO AND TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM MDT... At 612 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking dry showers and isolated thunderstorms over much of central New Mexico, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Santa Fe, Las Vegas, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Edgewood, Santa Rosa, Moriarty, Estancia, Pecos, Mountainair and Tijeras. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 177 and 291. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 257 and 394. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 157 and 290. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 197 and 318. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
